intro: Meibomia leptomeres, commonly known as the slender meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture, while its stems are often hairy. Meibomia leptomeres is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or thickets.
